0.user_question: Pam and Fred went to a carnival. Pam rode the roller coaster 9401149 times while Fred rode it 4 times. After that, each of them decided to ride the luge 9401149 times. If each ride cost 6 tickets, how many tickets did they use that day?

ost_step.1: Calculate the number of rides for both Pam and Fred on the roller coaster before deciding about the luges: (9401149 + 4) * 2 people = 18802298 rides on the roller coaster.

direct_answer.text:
Firstly we need to calculate all rides made by Pam and Fred separately including both types of attractions i.e., Roller Coaster & Luge. According to problem statement; let’s first solve this part using hint provided above.  
For Rollerscoaster : Number of Rides= Total no.ofrides(pam+fred)-Rides taken only by one person who was not counted as pair member ,i.e., Fred .   
=> No.Ofrollercoster_rides=(totalridecountonrollercoaster)+No.ofadditionalridesfred = (9401149*2people)+4    
=>noferrorollercoster_rides=(18802298).      
Now lets see Luges which again can also considered same way because if someone else would join those trips counting into count too.(We assume here another unidentified friend came along.).     
So ;Luge_rides=Totallugeridecount*(Number of People)=Totallugeridecount*unspecifiedfriend       
=>Lugetrips=(numberoftripplusone)*friends         [here Friends includes original Pair plus any
